docs.snippet: The steamship Alabama, Capt. SCHENCK, arrived yesterday from Annapolis, having landed her troops in good health. On Friday morning, at 6 o'clock, off the Delaware, passed the steamship Quaker City and a propeller (probably the Kedar) bound South.

headline.main: THE GOVERNMENT CHARTERED AND OTHER STEAMERS.

docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship Alabama, Capt. SCHENCK, arrived yesterday from Annapolis, having landed her troops in good health. On Friday morning, at 6 o'clock, off the Delaware, passed the steamship Quaker City and a propeller (probably the Kedar) bound South.

docs.snippet: There is, without doubt, a wide difference between the ideas and purposes of the Administration and those of the people, which should be reconciled with the least possible delay. Without wishing to trespass in any degree upon the legitimate functions...

headline.main: The Misunderstanding between the Government and the People.

docs.lead_paragraph: There is, without doubt, a wide difference between the ideas and purposes of the Administration and those of the people, which should be reconciled with the least possible delay. Without wishing to trespass in any degree upon the legitimate functions of Government, we take it that where the aims and wishes of the people are unmistakably expressed, they should become the law of the Government.

docs.snippet: The steamship Montgomery, BERRY, from Annapolis, arrived last night, bringiny Mrs. Capt. RODGERS, Mrs. Lieut. UPSHUR, and several of the Eighth Regiment of Massachusets, returned as a guard to the steamer. Passed the steamships Bienville and...
docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship Montgomery, BERRY, from Annapolis, arrived last night, bringiny Mrs. Capt. RODGERS, Mrs. Lieut. UPSHUR, and several of the Eighth Regiment of Massachusets, returned as a guard to the steamer. Passed the steamships Bienville and Monticello going up the Chesapeake, at 3 P.M., 27th.
